title: Agency Infrastructure
content: Welcome to Moonshine Capital. We are building a financial institution, not a hobby. Today is about ensuring your digital infrastructure is secure and compliant. We will set up your dedicated email, CRM access, and review the ISO handbook.

title: Core Products: MCA & Term Loans
summary: Mastering the mechanics of alternative lending.
content: You cannot sell what you do not understand. Today we dissect the core instruments: The Term Loan (stability), The Line of Credit (flexibility), and the Merchant Cash Advance (speed). You must know the buy rates and qualifications for each.

title: Underwriting Logic
summary: How to think like a lender to minimize declines.
content: Amateurs send every file; professionals filter. Today you learn the '5 Cs of Credit' and how to spot a decline before you even request a bank statement. We will review how to read a business bank statement for negative days and NSFs.

title: The Ideal Client Profile (ICP)
summary: Defining target industries and revenue floors.
content: Time is your only inventory. Do not waste it on startups. Today we define the Avatar: Revenue $25k/mo+, 2+ years in business, Construction/Medical/Logistics sectors. We focus on high-cash-flow entities.
tasks: Write down your Top 3 Target Niches
Create a 'Do Not Call' list based on restricted industries

title: The Tech Stack
content: Your CRM is your bank account. We are setting up your pipeline stages: Lead, Docs In, Submitted, Approved, Contracts Out, Funded. We will configure automations so you focus on talking, not data entry.

title: Disclosure & Ethics
content: Speed is our weapon, but integrity is our shield. We review truth-in-lending concepts, APR vs Factor Rate calculations, and commercial financing disclosure laws (like CA SB 1235).

title: Week 1 Review: The Simulation
content: The theory ends now. Today you will run a full simulation: Receiving a lead, qualifying them, gathering docs, and uploading to the Portal. If you can't do it in the sim, you can't do it in the market.

title: Sourcing: Building the List
content: Phase 2 is Prospecting. Today you build your 'Top 100' list. We look for local businesses with high capital intensity: HVAC, Trucking fleets, Manufacturing. You will use Google Maps and LinkedIn Sales Nav.

title: Cold Outreach Strategy
summary: The opener, the hook, and the pitch.
content: Nobody wakes up wanting a loan; they want to solve a cash flow problem. We will review the 'Gap Script': Identifying the gap between where they are and where they want to be.

title: Email Drip Campaigns
content: The phone is for hunting; email is for farming. Today we load your email sequences. You'll learn the difference between 'Spam' and 'Value-Add Follow-up' that gets a response.

title: Gatekeepers & Objections
content: The receptionist is trained to block you. You must be trained to bypass them. We use the 'Audit Approach' and the 'Partner Referral' angle to get to the Decision Maker (DM).
tasks: Practice rebuttal for 'We are good on capital'

title: Social Authority
content: People buy from experts. Today you optimize your LinkedIn profile to look like a Senior Funding Advisor. We will post your first 'Market Update' regarding interest rates.

title: Network Activation
content: Your phone already has money in it. Today we draft a professional message to your existing network asking for introductions to business owners in construction or logistics.

title: Week 2 Review: Live Fire
content: No more practice. Today you make 50 dials from your list. The goal is data collection: Get 3 people to say 'Send me an email' or 'Call me back'.

title: The Intake Process
content: Phase 3 is The Deal Cycle. The biggest drop-off point is document collection. We learn how to use urgency and scarcity to get the docs in under 2 hours.

title: Submission & Stips
content: Underwriters are busy. A messy file gets declined; a clean file gets funded. We cover naming conventions, PDF merging, and highlighting the 'Use of Funds' to make the story clear.

title: Reading the Offer
content: You received an approval. Now you must explain it. We break down the difference between APR and Factor Rate, daily vs weekly payments, and origination fees.

title: Closing Mechanics
content: This is where the money is made. We cover the 'Closing Call': walking the merchant through the contract, explaining the confession of judgment (if applicable), and scheduling the funding call.

title: Handling Declines
summary: Pivoting when the bank says no.
content: A 'No' is often just a 'Not this product'. We learn how to pivot a declined Term Loan into a Revenue Advance or Equipment Finance deal without losing the client.

title: Post-Funding Service
content: The first deal is for trust; the second deal is for profit. We set up the renewal calendar. A happy client renews at 50% paid down.

title: Week 3 Review: Pipeline Scrub
content: Review all active deals. Identify where files are stuck. Is it missing bank statements? Is the merchant ghosting? We apply the 'Break-Up' script to stallers.

title: Partnership Channels (CPAs)
content: Phase 4 is Scaling. Stop hunting one deal at a time. Partner with a CPA and get 10 deals a month. We review the value proposition for accounting partners.

title: Equipment Finance & SBA
content: Now that you mastered the basics, we introduce longer-term products. SBA 7(a) and Equipment Leasing. These take longer but pay massive commissions.

title: Vendor Programs
content: Work with people who sell yellow iron, trucks, or medical devices. You become their in-house finance department.

title: Time Management for Producers
content: Green Time (Selling) vs Red Time (Admin). We restructure your calendar to ensure you are on the phone from 9am-11am and 2pm-4pm every day.

title: Advanced Negotiation
content: Advanced tactics for high-revenue borrowers who shop around. How to match offers, sell on 'Net Cost' vs 'APR', and win the deal without dropping your commission.

title: Building a Sub-Team
content: The path to 7 figures involves leverage. We discuss the requirements for bringing on junior openers to feed your calendar.

title: Final Exam Prep
content: Reviewing products, compliance, underwriting, and sales tactics. Prepare for the final certification.

title: Certification Exam
content: Complete the final assessment. You must score 85% or higher to receive your 'Certified Partner' badge and increased commission split.

title: Launch Trajectory
content: Training is over. Production begins. We map out your revenue goals for Month 2 and Month 3. Welcome to the floor.
